resources.string:
If you have tested positive for COVID-19 or its antibodies, or had symptoms of the virus, you may be able to donate plasma to help treat coronavirus patients. Not everyone will be able to donate.
 The following criteria should be met for potential donors:
 - Age: > 18 Years
 - Male or nulliparous female donor of weight > 55 Kg
 - Prior diagnosis of Covid-19 documented by a laboratory test(RT-PCR) with symptomatic disease with at least fever and cough.
 - Complete resolution of Symptoms at least 28 days prior to donation; or Complete resolution of symptoms at least 14 days prior to donation and two negative real time PCR test for COVID-19 from nasopharyngeal swab, collected 24 hour apart.
